Draghi: Need to strengthen channels for genuine European democratic legitimacy, like the European Parliament
Draghi: Education, training need to be as much part of reform agenda as creating more flexible markets, reducing red tape
Draghi: Need to reconcile economics of integration, which is about efficiency, with politics of integration, which is about equity
Draghi: Need to make progress in terms of economic and institutional convergence
Draghi: Renationalising economies not the answer; need ambition in our ends and pragmatism in our means
Draghi: Difficult period of adjustment in some countries was first and foremost consequence of their past decisions
Draghi: Euro area not a political union where some countries permanently pay for others
Draghi: Solidarity central to European integration, right that countries have supported each other during the crisis http://t.co/m04qFZn8Y3

Draghi: Asset purchases' benefits for financing conditions increases benefits of governments' reforms, not reduce incentive for reforms
Draghi: ECB's recent monetary policy measures are valid and effective tool to bring inflation closer to ECB's policy goal
Draghi: Annual euro area inflation expected to remain very low or negative in months ahead, to start increasing gradually later this year
Draghi: Recent market reactions, experience from other jurisdictions show that the asset purchase programme can work
Draghi: We can deploy – and we are deploying – monetary policy in a way that can – and will – stabilise inflation
Draghi: Asset purchases are unconventional, but not unorthodox; have been part of the ECB's toolkit from the start

Monetary policy decisions http://t.co/5jGvUfqu0O
Georghadji: Remaining capital controls to be lifted soon
Draghi: If there would be market access, our monetary financing concerns would disappear
Draghi: ECB has already lent 100 bln to Greek banks and it has doubled the amount in the last two months
Draghi: If structural conditions are not in place, effectiveness of our measures is lower
Draghi: In February these conditions were not in place. It was even explicitly expressed by the government
Draghi: The Greek waiver existed as long as programme was by and large on track
Draghi: Essential that this solvency is maintained. Some communication undermines this, destroys collateral
Draghi: Greek banks are solvent and well above required capital levels at the moment
Draghi: We have raised ELA for Greek banks by 500 mln today
Draghi: Our current SMP holdings of Greek debt exceed the issuer limit of 33%. After redemptions in summer we could buy.
Draghi: We are ready to reinstate waiver if conditions are met
Draghi: We do not buy during a review
Draghi: Conditions to buy Greek bonds now are not in place
Draghi: Today's lending to Greece is 68% of Greece's GDP, which is the highest in the euro area
Draghi: Will not buy bonds yielding below deposit rate
Draghi: Objectives of set of measures which we started in July 2014 are being attained
Draghi: The ECB is a rule-based institution, not a political institution.
Draghi: Important to implement effectively the macroeconomic imbalance procedure to address excessive imbalances in individual Member States
Draghi: Fiscal policies should support the economic recovery while remaining in compliance with the Stability and Growth Pact
Draghi: Expected recovery leaves no room for complacency, decisive implementation of product and labour market reforms must gain momentum
Draghi: Staff projections are conditional on the full implementation of all ECB policy measures
Draghi: 2016 inflation projection has been revised upwards also to reflect expected impact from asset purchases
ECB March staff projections: euro area annual HICP 0.0 pct (+0.7 pct) in 2015, +1.5 pct (+1.3 pct) in 2016, +1.8 pct in 2017
ECB March staff projections: euro area annual real GDP +1.5 pct (+1.0 pct) in 2015, +1.9 pct (+1.5 pct) in 2016, +2.1 pct in 2017
Draghi: ECB expects economic recovery to gradually broaden and strengthen
Draghi: Transmission of ECB monetary policy steps will further improve economic growth outlook, reduce economic slack
Draghi: ECB has already seen significant number of positive effects following its decision to launch public sector debt purchases
Draghi: Additional information on implementation of programme to be released at 15:30 CET on ECB homepage
Draghi: ECB to buy until end-Sept 2016, in any case until ECB sees sustained adjustment in inflation path
